title: Null and Alternative Hypotheses
question_text:
A high school athletic director was interested whether high school males are more likely to compete in sports than high school females are.
He randomly sampled $200$ high school males across the country and found that $82$ of them participated in at least one high school sport at some point during the year. This compares to $68$ out of $200$ randomly sampled high school females who participated in at least one sport during the year.
Suppose you define $p_{1}$ as the proportion of high school males who participated in at least one sport over the last year and $p_{2}$ as the proportion of high school females who competed in at least one sport in the last year.
What would be the appropriate null and alternative hypotheses?
